Most Illustrious Sir

In view of your office of the 8th of the current month addressed to the collector of Jaguarão, and another from him to the Inspector of the Treasury, it is incumbent upon me to make Your Grace aware that

Without any deficit to the army, it is quite possible to fund the indispensable works of that fiscal department with men unfit for the campaign, who commonly abound in the districts; of these is that Your Grace

The nature and extent of our border with the neighboring State, as you know, invites smuggling; it is to prevent it, it is to impose deterrence, that the government devotes its activity and good intentions to this important branch of public service, in the part that concerns it.

Secretariat of Finance, Piratini, April 17, 1838.  
Domingos José de Almeida

To the citizen Vasco Madruga de Bitancurt, Justice of the Peace of Erval.  
From the Ministry of Finance.
